so creativity can be defined as the ability to think about a task or a problem in a new and different way or
the ability to use the imagination to generate new ideas creativity enables you to solve complex
problems or find interesting ways to approach tasks if you are creative you look at things from a unique perspective
now very tightly coupled to creativity we have the idea of innovation as well and it's probably something that's
quite important to everyone about innovation in the workplace these days and innovation is the practical implementation of ideas that result in
the introduction of new goods or services or improvements in offerings to goods and services
so creativity is new ways to address existing problems and mediums and innovation is implementing new products
services or ideas it's a very broad way of sort of describing what they are
so if we look at creativity some examples you know we said it's new ways of looking at existing problems so let's put that into context so art

there's different ways of looking at innovation so down the bottom axis we have technology existing technology
versus new technology and then we have on the vertical axis we have existing
markets versus new markets you know markets that we haven't currently sold our software into
so if we look at you know existing markets with existing technology then generally your innovation is more incremental things kind of move at a

idea of disruptive innovation now depending on what your thoughts are on blockchain the idea was it was
supposed to be a disruptive innovation is a brand new technology and a new concept that people are now trying to apply
to existing markets some successfully most not but it was supposed to be a disruptive innovation
if you have a new market and brand new technologies then you have what's classed as radical innovation and this

it to different markets so maybe your company works in nuclear and energy for example be then try to
apply it to financial services for example that's kind of classed as an architectural innovation taking
something you've already got but putting it into a different area
now creativity mostly we have this idea about the left and the right brain of a person so
people who are more creative tend to be right brain dominance and they are creative they've got good intuition artistic

problem they might come up with a perfectly valid but completely different solution to solving the same problem
which is why having the mix between the two people on the team i think is very important creativity makes you productive i think
it makes you productive because you're motivated and you want to do more and you want to be better at what you do so you hone your craft

a more um traditional um creative style is the six six thinking
hats by edward de bono so he's he's someone clever he knows what he's talking about but the idea
here is you think about different ideas but you put a different hat on when you're doing it it's like looking at a problem through
different lenses so for example we've got facts benefits cautions ideas feelings and process
so if you're designing a solution say a payment system for example you might put your facts hat
on and you think what are the facts about this system well the facts are i need to support i don't know
mastercard and visa and american express and the facts are that i'm gonna have to pay a certain percentage transaction fee
you know you think about just the pure raw facts around what it is you're trying to do i have to be pci dss certified i can't
store um cvv numbers of people's cards you know just the raw facts
and then you might then you take that hat off and you put your benefits hat on what the benefits of this system why if i build this what's going to be the
benefit to my end user are there any benefits should you just use stripe instead
maybe but you might think well actually if i build this system this payment system
actually it could be useful for anyone so i could actually turn it into a product and i could be the next stripe for
example so you think about what the benefits of building that system are to you
can you put your cautions hat on well what are the things that can really bite me here what can get me into trouble well transaction fees can change from
credit card providers arbitrarily if anyone heard that in in the uk
amazon's going to stop supporting i think his mastercard credit cards was it visa credit cards one of the two because
the transaction fees have gone up so amazon has said nope not supporting those cards anymore from january
you know that is a risk isn't it so yeah cautions are thinking about the things that could get you into trouble
regulatory compliance that's something that always trips companies up because it's hard if you don't set your systems up
correctly you put yourself into a scope of a massive pci dss audit which is expensive and painful for everyone
so those are the cautions then you put your ideas hat on and you just start coming up with like you know the brainstorming techniques of lots of
different ideas you know how can we make this system different to stripe you know are we are we going to offer
hosted iframes that you put your card numbers in are we going to i don't know i can't think of any stuff
in my head not worked on payment systems for a while but this is where you just think of like your general ideas and what could potentially become feature
sets then you put your feelings hat on
and feelings is kind of where you start thinking about certainly in terms of software development trying to make it relevant to the
conference but this could be like where you start thinking about different personas of people that might be using your system
and how they feel so you might have a persona which is the you know the young 30 year old professional who likes to
buy sandwiches online or you've got the the mom at home who needs to go and buy
provisions for the family you know i mean the different different personas and you start thinking about
how they feel about using your system so is the system designed to be easy to use are there any barriers to entry how many
clicks have you got to go through to make a payments it's where you start thinking about how different design choices can affect
different people as you go through the design process and then the final one you take that off
and you put the process hat on this is where you start looking at the actual physical process of what you're going to build so you really at this point you're
starting to get into more of a larger design or breaking it down into stories if it's
agile let's be careful when you talk about building a design people go no in agile
you don't do that well you start going into more detail and more depth
so another technique and i've used this in well i haven't used it i've been the recipient of it in you know
creativity workshops and companies i've worked at and this is a really really good icebreaker if you've got a lot of people in a room and you're going to
have a big long workshop to try and think up ideas especially if you've got people in there
that you don't ordinarily work with from around the business so everyone's a bit new and a bit nervous there's a technique called blind storytelling it's
brilliant fun really really good fun so what you do the first person has a gun they write two or three sentences in a paragraph
um you know there was a dragon called jeff and he lived with a squirrel called cyril and he lived in a big cave then what he
did is you fold the paper over and you just leave the last sentence so he lived in a big cave then the next person has no idea what came before it except for
that sentence so they then write two or three sentences they fold the paper over leave the last sentence then the next person has a go
and by the time you've done this 10 times around the room and people can write whatever they want you then read the story out as a whole
it's normally incredibly silly and has everyone in hysterics laughing which is a really good icebreaker it's a
good party game as well if you ever got a family around the christmas table it starts getting a bit awkward because
grandpa said something a bit rude you can just start playing this game which is really cool
